context: The word 'kolis' is the past tense third person singular form of the Estonian verb 'kola', which means to move or relocate. It indicates that someone moved to a new location in the past. The root form 'kola' can be conjugated in different tenses and persons: kolan (I move), kolad (you move), kolab (he/she/it moves), kolame (we move), kolate (you plural move), kolavad (they move).
